name: config-dlna_fixed_port
description: Hardcoded DLNA server port configuration detected. While the port number itself is not sensitive credentials, publicly exposed fixed ports may be exploited by attackers for scanning and attacks. Consider using random ports or implementing firewall rules to restrict access.
notes: Sensitive information type: Fixed network port; Value: 8200

name: config-device_hardcoded_info
description: Hardcoded device serial numbers and model information detected. This information could be used for device fingerprinting or targeted attacks. It is recommended to use randomly generated serial numbers or device-specific identifiers.

name: config-exposed_internal_path
description: The media directory configuration contains test data paths, potentially exposing the internal file system structure. The paths include the REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDER 'zhu' and test directory information, which may reveal internal account structures.

name: config-ushare_secure_configuration
description: The configuration file contains various settings for the uShare service, but all fields that may involve sensitive information (such as USHARE_NAME, USHARE_IFACE, USHARE_PORT, etc.) are either empty or commented out. While no sensitive information was found, it is recommended to keep these configuration items empty or use secure values, especially when deploying in production environments.
notes: Security assessment: No sensitive information detected; Recommendation: Maintain current security configuration status

name: directory-wlan_default_empty
description: The directory 'etc/wlan/default' was found to be empty. No files were present to analyze for hardcoded credentials or sensitive information.
notes: No further analysis possible on empty directory. Consider checking other directories in 'etc/wlan/' for potential credentials.

name: directory-web_login_clean
description: No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were found in the files under the web/login directory. All inspected files were either image files (.png) or SVN version control files (.svn-base), containing image binary data and version control metadata, with no identifiable credentials or sensitive information.
code_snippet: N/A (Image and version control files only)
notes: Although no sensitive information was found, it is recommended to check other directories, especially those containing configuration files and scripts.

name: auth-base64_encoded_credentials
notes: authentication_mechanism: Base64-encoded credentials; it is recommended to use more secure authentication mechanisms such as HTTPS and session tokens

name: info-security_policy_disclosure
description: The error message for authentication reveals system security restrictions: REDACTED_PASSWORD_PLACEHOLDERs and passwords cannot exceed 15 characters or contain spaces, and only one administrator is allowed to log in simultaneously. This information could potentially be exploited by attackers for brute force or DoS attacks.
notes: Information Type: Security Policy Details; Suggest modifying error messages to avoid disclosing system security policies.

name: directory-samba_lib_clean
description: No credentials or sensitive information containing readable ASCII strings were found in the etc/samba/lib directory. All files (lowcase.dat, upcase.dat, valid.dat) are either image data or contain no extractable text content.

name: config-memory_management
description: Potential memory management adjustment operation detected. The script modified parameters under /proc/sys/vm/, which may affect system security and stability.
notes: These adjustments may be performance optimizations, but improper settings could lead to system instability.

name: config-network_tuning
description: Network parameter adjustment detected. The script modified the IP fragment high threshold, which may affect network performance and security.
notes: This setting may be related to DoS protection, it is recommended to check the network configuration.

name: script-kernel_modules_loader
description: A comprehensive analysis of the file etc/rc.d/rc.modules revealed no hardcoded credentials or sensitive information. This file is a kernel module loading script containing only standard module loading commands and comments.
notes: No sensitive information was found, but it is recommended to check all loaded kernel modules (/lib/modules/2.6.36/) for potential vulnerabilities.

name: script-iptables_stop
description: No hardcoded credentials or sensitive information were found in the file etc/rc.d/iptables-stop. This file is a standard iptables stop script containing only commands to clear firewall rules.
